DOC.brief_summary: This study is to quantify the effect of a natural fruit extract added to a wheat product on the time needed to absorb 50% of the apparent total of available exogenous carbohydrate (RaE * Time). In addition the different glucose fluxes will be quantified (RaE, EGP and GCR)
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of a Natural Extract on Glucose Fluxes After Consumption of a Wheat Product
DOC.criteria: Healthy Caucasian male. Body mass index (BMI) ≥ 18.0 and ≤ 25.0 kg/m2. Apparently healthy: no medical conditions which might affect the study measurements including diabetes type 1 and type 2, gastrointestinal dysfunction, gastrointestinal surgery and inflammatory diseases. Fasting blood glucose value of volunteer is ≥ 3.4 and ≤ 6.1 mmol/liter (i.e. 62 110 mg/dl) at screening. HbA1c ≤ 6.5 % (48 mmol/mol). Use of antibiotics within 3 months before Day 1; use of any other medication except paracetamol within 14 days before Day 1.
